definition: to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
close the country to international intercourse
closed-door policy

sentences.english: The closed-door policy of the Qing dynasty closed people's visions and minds.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國政策封禁了人們的眼界和思想。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，停滯不前成了這個文明古國的代名詞。

sentences.english: One when he was probably kind of forced into six months retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他可能被逼去做了六個月的閉關而做的夢。

sentences.english: No country can develop healthily with its door closed.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，任何一個國家都不能健康的發展。

sentences.english: Yet these advantages could all be frittered away if the nation were to close its borders.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們閉關鎖國，排斥移民，這些優勢將蕩然無存。

sentences.english: When Bankei held his seclusion-weeks of meditation, pupils from many parts of Japan came to attend.
sentences.chinese: 盤珪閉關時，總有弟子從各地趕來一同打坐。

sentences.english: Turkmenistan's shackling is typical of broader failure in the region.
sentences.chinese: 土庫曼斯坦的閉關鎖國是這個區域更大的失敗。

sentences.english: I am looking for a very nice website design for our yoga retreat center.
sentences.chinese: 我想給我們的瑜伽閉關中心網站設計非常漂亮。

sentences.english: He proceeds to shut Japan off from the rest of the world, something his successors continue for 250 years.
sentences.chinese: 他從閉關鎖國中獲益，他的繼承人延續到250年後。

sentences.english: A retreat practice written by Yogi Chen based on traditional Chan training.
sentences.chinese: 陳上師所作，基於傳統禪修訓練的閉關修法。

sentences.english: The close-door policy couldn't steer a country to prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 閉關自守的政策不能引導國家走向繁榮。

sentences.english: By afternoon, I closed our doors started to review, the placement test is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 到了下午，我閉關房門開始複習，分班考試迫在眉睫。

sentences.english: A closed economy will not put a country on the way to prosperity .
sentences.chinese: 閉關自守的經濟不會使一個國家富起來。

sentences.english: As a consequence, the country declined into poverty and ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 長期閉關自守，把中國搞得貧窮落後，愚昧無知。

sentences.english: We pursued the policy of “self-seclusion” in the past, resulting in “the destitution of the people and exhaustion of the financial resource”.
sentences.chinese: 過去實行“閉關自守”政策，結果搞得“民窮財困”。

sentences.english: All of us come down on the closed door policy of the government.
sentences.chinese: 我們所有的人都對政府的閉關政策。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to confess/to repent/remorse/repentance/penitent/confession (Buddhism)
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
there
at last/in the end/finally/eventually
meditation
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
(verb suffix)
termination/to finish/to end/to conclude/to close
week/religious service/worship/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to read a book/to study/to attend school
to learn/to study
to review (a lesson etc)
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
so-called/what is called
